text:
Question 58) Planning has failed to control urban growth and has encouraged it by all possible and imaginable means. Cities, the new message sounded loud and sound, were machines to produce wealth; The first and main objective of planning should be that of oil.
HALL, P. Cities of Tomorrow: An intellectual history of planning and project The urban planning model problematized in the text is marked by
A) Primacy of popular management.
B) use of sustainable practices.
C) Construction of social welfare.
D) sovereignty of government power.
E) expansion of business participation.
